org.fishwife.jrugged

Class RequestCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fishwife.jrugged.RequestCounter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServiceWrapper

    public class RequestCounter
extends Object
implements ServiceWrapper
    This is a statistics wrapper that counts total requests, as well as how many succeed and how many fail. This class can be polled periodically to measure request rates, success rates, and failure rates.

      • invoke

        public <T> T invoke(Runnable r,
                    T result)
             throws Exception
        Wrap the given service call with the RequestCounter to count the number of calls made.
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface ServiceWrapper
        Type Parameters:
        T - The return TYPE that should emit
        Parameters:
        r - the Runnable to attempt
        result - what to return after r succeeds
        Returns:
        result
        Throws:
        Exception - if c throws one during execution

      • sample

        public long[] sample()
        Samples the current counts.
        Returns:
        an array of three longs: the total number of requests, the number of successful requests, and the number of failed requests.
